local_clues.quote: the squat is possibly the most useful and functional exercise out there today
local_clues.clue: Introduces the importance of squats, indicating the context of their significance.

local_clues.quote: i want to share a 30-day plan that you can use to improve your legs strength endurance and mobility
local_clues.clue: Mentions a 30-day plan for improving leg strength, endurance, and mobility, providing context for general goals and improvements expected.

local_clues.quote: over the last 10 years i've done a lot of squatting from barbell variations to then moving into bodyweight more challenging single leg variations but the focus has always been on intensity
local_clues.clue: Mentions extensive experience with various squatting techniques and the focus on intensity, indicating a background of significant practice and experimentation.

global_clues.quote: seek a range of motion that's as deep as possible for you trying to get your thigh to touch your calf is a good goal to shoot for
global_clues.clue: Encourages a full range of motion, which is relevant to any demonstration of squats, highlighting an ideal performance standard.
global_clues.relevance_to_segment: Recommends achieving a deep squat, which pertains to assessing the depth and form being demonstrated in this segment.

global_clues.quote: elevate your heels elevating your heels will allow you to get deeper and it also shifts more weight into your toes which puts more stress on the quads
global_clues.clue: Suggests heel elevation as a technique to improve squat depth and engage the quads more effectively.
global_clues.relevance_to_segment: Provides context on how to achieve deeper squats and engage muscles, which could be a focus or mentioned in this segment.

local_clues.quote: be honest in the past i thought this was too basic for me but what i found is that i was overlooking a huge component of fitness

local_clues.quote: it's simple if you spend more time in a position your body will allow you to go there easier and this has made my ankles knees and hips feel really good
local_clues.clue: Spending more time in squat position improves flexibility and joint health, indicating positive changes from practice.

global_clues.quote: your body loves it when you gradually increase the volume over time and once again you shouldn't be getting too sore or causing too much fatigue because of this gradual ramp up
global_clues.clue: Mentions gradual volume increase to prevent fatigue, relevant to any physical training guidance.
global_clues.relevance_to_segment: Indicates a measured approach to increasing squat volume, which may relate to advice or demonstrations given in this segment.

local_clues.quote: and test if your range of motion has increased feel free to repeat this 30-day cycle with using a higher rep count so if you did it with 20 you can do it again with 25 or even 30.
local_clues.clue: Discusses testing range of motion and suggests repeating the cycle with a higher rep count to further improve squat performance.

global_clues.quote: at the end of each set I want you to stand up you can kind of shake out your legs for a sec and then sit back down into the bottom of your squat position for at least a minute
global_clues.clue: Advises incorporating short breaks and holding the squat position to enhance muscle engagement and flexibility.
